Brazil: The Portuguese establish Recife in Pernambuco, north-east of Brazil.
Colombia: Foundation of St. Juan de Pasto by Lorenzo de Aldana
Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada with his troops reach the Muisca Confederation
zipa Tisquesusa is beaten in the Spanish conquest of the Muisca at Funza
Sagipa becomes the last zipa of Bacatá
Francisco César discovers the territory of Antioquia
Aquiminzaque becomes the last zaque of Hunza
The Sun Temple in Sogamoso (name in Muysccubun: Sugamuxi) was burned by Spanish soldiers
Cuba: A French fleet briefly occupies Havana.
A rebellion by enslaved Africans and indigenous people is crushed.
French corsairs blockade Santiago de Cuba.
Ireland: FitzGerald was hanged, drawn, and quartered at Tyburn.
Serbia: Klis Fortress succumbs to the Ottomans enabling Senj to become a Croatian Habsburg Uskok (pirate) stronghold in the Adriatic Sea. Although nominally accepting the sovereignty of the Habsburg Emperor Ferdinand I, Uskoci were a law unto themselves, comprise by refugees from Croatia, Bosnia and Serbia.
